oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tom T. Hall Live at the Lone Star Cafe - 1981-08-24
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is from the Lonestar Cafe live show. The tape features a live performance of Tom T. Hall (musician). The Lonestar Cafe show is presented by Mort Cooperman, Bill McGivney and the WHN radio network. The recording of Tom T. Hall is from August 24, 1981.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tom T. Hall
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Mike Fitzgerald introduces Tom T. Hall -- (00:05) Country is [featuring Mike Fitzgerald voiceover] (Tom T. Hall) -- (02:50) Hall greets the audience and jokes about WHN -- (04:06) Ballad of Forty Dollars (Tom T. Hall) -- (07:10) Hall addresses a note left for him and drinking for health -- (09:01) Homecoming (Tom T. Hall) -- (12:00) Hall thanks the audience -- (12:24) Faster Horses (Tom T. Hall) -- (14:40) Hall reflects on the distances traveled by audience members -- (15:35) The Year That Clayton Delaney Died (Tom T. Hall) -- (18:00) Hall reflects on a story a truck driver told him -- (18:44) Ravishing Ruby (Tom T. Hall) -- (21:14) Hall thanks WHN and reflects on Roy Clark -- (22:06) Unidentified banjo tune (Tom T. Hall) -- (24:26) I Know You're Married But I Love You Still (Tom T. Hall) -- (26:35) Hall reflects on his band -- (27:12) Fox on the Run (Tom T. Hall) -- (29:34) Hall invites an audience member on stage -- (31:05) Your Man Loves You, Honey (Tom T. Hall) -- (33:55) Sneaky Snake (Tom T. Hall) -- (36:09) I Love (Tom T. Hall) -- (39:12) I Like Beer (Tom T. Hall) -- (42:47) Hall addresses the radio audience -- (43:21) She Gave Her Heart to Jethro (Tom T. Hall) -- (47:26) Hall asks for audience assistance -- (47:45) Me and Jesus (Tom T. Hall) -- (51:50) Hall converses with the crowd -- (52:20) (Old Dogs Children and) Watermelon Wine (Tom T. Hall) -- (55:37) Unidentified tune [featuring Tom T. Hall and Mike Fitzgerald voiceover] (Tom T. Hall)
